Pre-Game Insights: Burundi turned in a resilient team display in last Thursday’s Group L curtain-raiser as they secured a 3-2 victory over Malawi at the Bingu National Stadium.
Senegal were left red-faced in their group opener on Friday as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Burkina Faso at the Stade Me Abdoulaye Wade.
Others: Burundi have now gone four consecutive games without defeat, picking up two wins and two draws — a run that has seen them rise to third place in Group F of the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers.
Senegal have now failed to win three of their last four competitive matches — losing once and claiming two draws — with a 1-0 victory over Mauritania on June 9 being the exception.
